It depends on the location and size of the band-aid. If the band-aid is small and located in an area that will not be treated during the facial, it may be possible to have a facial while still wearing the band-aid. However, if the band-aid is large or located in an area that will be treated during the facial, it is best to reschedule the appointment for when the band-aid can be removed.

During a facial, the esthetician uses various tools and products that require access to the skin's surface. If the band-aid is covering an area of the face that needs to be treated, it can interfere with the proper application and absorption of products. Additionally, the esthetician needs to be able to see the skin clearly to determine the appropriate treatment and to avoid causing further irritation or damage to the skin.

If the band-aid is covering a wound, it's important to allow the skin to heal before getting a facial. The use of certain products and techniques during a facial can slow down the healing process and increase the risk of infection.

Overall, it's best to be honest with your esthetician about any bandages or wounds you have before your facial appointment. They can help you decide if it's safe to proceed with the treatment or if it's best to reschedule for a later date.
